title: ‘Astronaut’ Families Stressed by Straddling 2 Worlds: China and Canada
first_paragraph: Bonnie Ye, 42, left China four years ago to marry a Vancouver man she met on a Chinese matchmaking website. Soon, her husband was shuttling between China and two homes in Vancouver, leaving her alone for long stretches to care for their young daughter. Now, the two are divorced.

title: Western Universities Rely on China. After the Virus, That May Not Last.
first_paragraph: On Jiani Zhou’s university campus in southwestern England, the racism arrived before the coronavirus did.

title: As Iran Reels, Trump Aides Clash Over Escalating Military Showdown
first_paragraph: President Trump was getting ready to declare the coronavirus a “national emergency,” but inside the White House last Thursday, a tense debate erupted among the president and his top advisers on a far different subject: whether the United States should escalate military action against Iran, a longtime American rival that has been devastated by the epidemic.

title: The Pandemic That Ravaged Canada and Its Lessons for Today
first_paragraph: These days, walking around downtown Ottawa, and likely most other places in Canada, is an experience that’s both encouraging and melancholy.

title: In Shift, Trudeau Says Canada Will Return Asylum Seekers to U.S.
first_paragraph: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau reversed his government’s open immigration stance and said Canada would begin turning back asylum seekers who walk in from the United States outside of official border crossings.

title: Johnson Orders British Pubs to Close, Ending a Maverick Stance in Virus Fight
first_paragraph: For days, Prime Minister Boris Johnson charted a defiantly maverick course in Britain’s response to the coronavirus pandemic, refusing to shut down large parts of his country, as many other European leaders have.

title: Europe Struggles to Combat Coronavirus as Spain Passes Grim Milestone
first_paragraph: Spain passed a grim milestone on Friday when it became the second European country to report over 1,000 coronavirus deaths, a mark that Italy passed a week ago, with the country’s doctors warning that the health system may soon be overwhelmed, just as in Italy.

title: Photos From a Century of Epidemics
first_paragraph: There are times when the planet resets its course with a cruelty that seems as capricious as it is implacable. The coronavirus pandemic, spreading octopus tentacles into every crevice of society, is one of them, pitting the vanity of human assumptions against nature’s almost casual ability to destroy them. It is not the first time.

title: Another Virus Victim: The U.S. as a Global Leader in a Time of Crisis
first_paragraph: In the name of “America First,” President Trump has pulled out of the Paris climate agreement and questioned the usefulness of the United Nations and NATO, displaying his distaste for the multinational institutions the United States had constructed and led since World War II.

title: Thanks to Sanctions, Russia Is Cushioned From Virus’s Economic Shocks
first_paragraph: Six years ago, the United States and the European Union slammed the door on Western bank loans for Russian companies, starving the country’s oil and banking industries of financing. The harsh measure, and others that followed, were intended to punish Russia for military interventions in Ukraine and Syria and for meddling in the 2016 American election to help Donald J. Trump.

title: ‘None of Us Have a Fear of Corona’: The Faithful at an Outbreak’s Center
first_paragraph: The faithful prayed by the thousands, hands and faces washed at communal taps to signify their purity. They crowded around platters on the floor, scooping up coconut rice with their right hands in the traditional way. And they slept in the mosque or in tents set up in the religious compound, rows of pilgrims from nearly 30 countries, gathered in Malaysia for spiritual renewal.

title: Can’t Get Tested? Maybe You’re in the Wrong Country
first_paragraph: Scientists around the world were waiting at their computers in early January when China released the coronavirus genetic code, the blueprint for creating tests and vaccines. Within days, labs from Hong Kong to Berlin had designed tests and shared their research with others.

title: The Relief of Clear Instructions in the Age of Coronavirus
first_paragraph: When I stepped off a Qantas flight from Los Angeles to Melbourne this past Tuesday, health officials in protective gear handed me a piece of paper instructing me to self-quarantine for 14 days. Strangely, those instructions came as a relief. At last, someone was giving me definitive guidelines on what to do in response to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Queen Urges Britons to Pull Together as Nation Charts an Uncertain Course
first_paragraph: Queen Elizabeth II on Thursday urged the British people to pull together even as they move apart, hoping to steady a country that has veered between alarm and complacency as the government has struggled to present a consistent message about its response to the coronavirus.

title: ‘Wash Our Hands? Some People Can’t Wash Their Kids for a Week.’
first_paragraph: In northwestern Syria, where a million people who have fled the civil war are sheltering in muddy tent camps and abandoned buildings, the spread of the coronavirus could wreak untold disaster on a devastated region.

title: ‘It’s Very Scary’: U.K. Food Banks Close as Coronavirus Stalls Donations
first_paragraph: As panicked shoppers in Britain empty supermarket shelves and hoard goods amid the coronavirus outbreak, food banks that depend on donations are struggling to stay afloat, and some have been forced to shut down.

title: World Feared China Over Coronavirus. Now the Tables Are Turned.
first_paragraph: The fear and suspicion directed at China in the devastating early days of the coronavirus outbreak have made a 180-degree turn: It is the West that now frightens Asia and the rest of the world.

title: China Hits a Coronavirus Milestone: No New Local Infections
first_paragraph: China on Thursday reported no new local infections for the first time since the coronavirus crisis began three months ago, reaching a milestone in its battle with the deadly outbreak that has upended daily life and economic activity around the world.

title: ‘We Are Frightened’: U.K. Doctors Brace for a Coronavirus Explosion
first_paragraph: As the coronavirus bears down on Britain’s overstretched National Health Service, doctors say they fear trying days of hard choices and rationed resources.

title: Locked-Down Europe Faces Closed Borders, Economic Wounds and Dire Warnings
first_paragraph: Drivers faced daylong waits to cross European borders that nations raced to close on Wednesday, years after proudly throwing them open. Britain closed schools to millions of children amid talk of shutting down London. And Germany’s stoic leader made an unusually personal appeal for unity and purpose in the face of crisis.

title: Its Coronavirus Cases Dwindling, China Turns Focus Outward
first_paragraph: China’s leader, Xi Jinping, pledged to send more medical experts to Italy this week, on the same day Beijing sent 2,000 rapid diagnostic tests to the Philippines. Serbia’s president pleaded for assistance not from the country’s neighbors in Europe, which restricted the export of needed medical equipment, but from China.

title: Is Coronavirus Widening Generational Divides, or Bridging Them?
first_paragraph: When Austria’s Parliament announced severe restrictions on movement on Sunday, two young Austrian roommates rushed to two supermarkets and a pharmacy before the rules came into force.

title: Netanyahu’s Bold Moves: Fighting a Virus or Risking Democracy?
first_paragraph: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was supposed to be facing trial this week on bribery, fraud and breach of trust charges.

title: Power Struggle Hampers Iran’s Coronavirus Response
first_paragraph: More senior government figures have caught the coronavirus in Iran than anywhere else. Field hospitals have been erected in parking lots, stadiums and wedding halls to handle the overflow of patients.

title: Europe Barricades Borders to Slow Coronavirus
first_paragraph: The spiraling coronavirus epidemic tore into the fabric of Europe on Tuesday, prompting its leaders to all but wall the continent off from the rest of the world and erect barriers within it, and to throttle back or turn off the engines of ordinary life and livelihoods in hopes of slowing the deadly spread.

title: Anti-Russian Protests Erupt in Ukraine, Despite Virus Threat
first_paragraph: Ukraine, like many countries, has closed schools and banned mass gatherings to combat the coronavirus. But unlike others, it has struggled to tamp down street protests, which persist over the war in the country’s separatist east.

title: Asylum Seekers Say U.S. is Returning Them to the Dangers They Fled
first_paragraph: Yovani has a strategy for staying alive: He will not let anyone know he is back in Honduras, he will move homes every couple of weeks and he will stay indoors.

title: Paris, a Magnet for the World, Becomes a Ghost City After a Lockdown Takes Effect
first_paragraph: An exodus from Paris at the Gare Montparnasse train station. A postal worker warning of the plague, the apocalypse and repentance, with the Eiffel Tower behind him. Fear in people’s eyes, and tense moments, in a long line outside a supermarket.

title: Tracking the Coronavirus: How Crowded Asian Cities Tackled an Epidemic
first_paragraph: Two hours. That’s all the time medical teams in Singapore are given to uncover the first details of how patients contracted the coronavirus and which people they might infect.

title: Having Brushed Off Coronavirus Threat, Southeast Asia Begins to Confront It
first_paragraph: For months, many Southeast Asian countries played down the threat posed by the new coronavirus. Some officials said that prayer would keep the disease away. Others expressed optimism that the tropical heat would slow the spread of the virus.

title: Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson Are Released From the Hospital
first_paragraph: The actors Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson have been released from an Australian hospital and will remain in self-isolation after being treated for Covid-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus, their son said in a video statement on Monday.

title: India Scrambles to Escape a Coronavirus Crisis. So Far, It’s Working.
first_paragraph: Over the weekend in Lucknow, one of India’s bigger cities, young people packed into pubs. Despite the Indian government scrambling to lock things down, few on the bar scene were taking the coronavirus very seriously.

title: Britain Stiffens Its Response to the Coronavirus, Somewhat
first_paragraph: Britain, which had stood apart from other nations in the relaxed nature of its response to the coronavirus, hardened those measures significantly on Monday, urging people to stop going to pubs or restaurants, and putting in place strict quarantine policies for those infected by the virus.

title: Macron Declares France ‘at War’ With Virus, as E.U. Proposes 30-Day Travel Ban
first_paragraph: Adopting martial language, President Emmanuel Macron ordered the French to stay at home for at least the next 15 days, as France put in place some of the most severe measures in Europe to try to curb the raging coronavirus.

title: Italy’s Coronavirus Victims Face Death Alone, With Funerals Postponed
first_paragraph: At around midnight on Wednesday, Renzo Carlo Testa, 85, died from the coronavirus in a hospital in the northern Italian town of Bergamo. Five days later, his body was still sitting in a coffin, one of scores lined head-to-toe in the church of the local cemetery, which is itself closed to the public.

title: To Track Coronavirus, Israel Moves to Tap Secret Trove of Cellphone Data
first_paragraph: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel has authorized the country’s internal security agency to tap into a vast and previously undisclosed trove of cellphone data to retrace the movements of people who have contracted the coronavirus and identify others who should be quarantined because their paths crossed.

title: In Afghanistan, Coronavirus Complicates War and Peace
first_paragraph: When the coronavirus began spreading, many Afghans were in denial even after it became an obvious and deadly crisis in neighboring Iran.

title: U.S. Offered ‘Large Sum’ to German Company for Access to Coronavirus Vaccine Research, German Officials Say
first_paragraph: The Trump administration attempted to persuade a German firm developing a possible vaccine for coronavirus to move its research work to the United States, German officials said, raising fears in Berlin that President Trump was trying to assure that any inoculation would be available first, and perhaps exclusively, in the United States.

title: Spain, on Lockdown, Weighs Liberties Against Containing Coronavirus
first_paragraph: The scene is becoming all too familiar, and now it has gripped Spain: Streets are empty, shops are shuttered, families are cloistered at home and the numbers of those infected with the coronavirus, and those who have died, are growing.

title: A Lockdown, Paris-Style: ‘We Can’t Live Without Bread’
first_paragraph: Parisians took the French government’s partial lockdown measures in stride on Sunday, half shrugging off the coronavirus threat and only limiting their normal weekend’s activities: shopping at open-air markets, strolling in parks and lining up outside bakeries and butchers.

title: Europeans Erect Borders Against Coronavirus, but the Enemy Is Already Within
first_paragraph: The “gilded museum” of Europe is hollow and echoing. The great squares and stadiums are empty, the museums shut, the churches hesitant about services, the fine restaurants and cool bars shuttered.

title: As Coronavirus Deepens Inequality, Inequality Worsens Its Spread
first_paragraph: As the coronavirus spreads across the globe, it appears to be setting off a devastating feedback loop with another of the gravest forces of our time: economic inequality.

title: Benny Gantz, With Thin Majority, Wins Chance to Form Israeli Government
first_paragraph: Benny Gantz, the centrist former army chief battling to depose Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, on Sunday won the endorsements of a narrow majority of lawmakers, earning him a fresh chance to form a government and break Israel’s yearlong political deadlock.

title: Shutdowns Spread Across Europe as Spain and France Order Broad Restrictions
first_paragraph: The shutdown of Europe expanded drastically on Saturday as more countries shuttered businesses, locked up borders and chased people off streets and into their homes in a race to contain the growing threat of the coronavirus.

title: Chinese Tycoon Who Criticized Xi’s Response to Coronavirus Has Vanished
first_paragraph: His nickname in China was “The Cannon,” and Ren Zhiqiang’s latest commentary was among his most explosive yet.

title: Spain Imposes Nationwide Lockdown to Fight Coronavirus
first_paragraph: Faced with a sharp rise in coronavirus cases, Spain on Saturday became the second country in Europe to impose sweeping restrictions on the public, telling everyone to stay indoors, with limited exceptions.

title: As Europe Shuts Down, Britain Takes a Different, and Contentious, Approach
first_paragraph: Prime Minister Boris Johnson of Britain once said his political hero was the mayor in the film “Jaws,” praising him for defying mass hysteria to keep the beaches open after a constituent is eaten by a shark.

title: How Far Can Canada Go to Slow Spread of the New Coronavirus?
first_paragraph: It’s well beyond the space limitations of this newsletter to summarize the new coronavirus developments of the last week internationally, let alone in Canada. Here at The Times, we’ve been drawing on our journalists around the world to produce a steady flow of reporting on the health crisis.

title: At the Iranian Border, Iraqis Try to Keep a Virus From Entering
first_paragraph: The voices rose angrily and a knot of people gathered on the Iraqi side of the border crossing with Iran. Two Iranian diplomats were trying to get relatives out of Iran, where the coronavirus is rampant, and into Iraq.

title: Spain Becomes Latest Epicenter of Coronavirus After a Faltering Response
first_paragraph: Just last weekend, about 120,000 people marched through downtown Madrid to celebrate International Women’s Day. Some 60,000 soccer fans filled one of the city’s largest stadiums. And 9,000 supporters of Vox, Spain’s third-largest party, gathered inside a former bullring.

title: Israel’s Coronavirus Crisis Lets Netanyahu Seize the Initiative
first_paragraph: The scourge of coronavirus converged this week with Israel’s yearlong electoral impasse, creating a crisis that could politically benefit the country’s embattled but indefatigable prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Fears Rise for World Leaders as Officials Test Positive for Virus
first_paragraph: Even as governments around the world struggle to contain the coronavirus pandemic, many officials are themselves falling victim to the pathogen, undermining global efforts to address the crisis.

title: China Spins Tale That the U.S. Army Started the Coronavirus Epidemic
first_paragraph: China is pushing a new theory about the origins of the coronavirus: It is an American disease that might have been introduced by members of the United States Army who visited Wuhan in October.

title: Sophie Grégoire Trudeau, Wife of Canada’s Leader, Tests Positive for Coronavirus
first_paragraph: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau will remain in isolation for the next two weeks after Sophie Grégoire Trudeau, his wife, tested positive for the new coronavirus, his office said in a statement on Thursday.

title: Johnson Holds Back on Restrictive Measures in U.K.’s Fight to Curb Virus
first_paragraph: Prime Minister Boris Johnson, resisting mounting pressure to fall in line with the radical responses of other European countries to try to curb the coronavirus, stuck to a notably restrained set of measures on Thursday, even as the Trump administration exempted Britain from a trans-Atlantic travel ban.

title: Italy’s Health Care System Groans Under Coronavirus — a Warning to the World
first_paragraph: The mayor of one town complained that doctors were forced to decide not to treat the very old, leaving them to die. In another town, patients with coronavirus-caused pneumonia were being sent home. Elsewhere, a nurse collapsed with her mask on, her photograph becoming a symbol of overwhelmed medical staff.

title: Chaos in Europe, and Anger, Over U.S. Travel Ban to Curb Coronavirus
first_paragraph: From airports and government offices to company boardrooms and stock exchange floors, turmoil and anger spread across Europe on Thursday after President Trump abruptly blocked most visitors from the Continent to the United States to curb the spread of the coronavirus.

title: What You Need to Know About Trump’s European Travel Ban
first_paragraph: President Trump’s announcement of sweeping restrictions on travel from much of Europe to the United States dropped like a hammer on Wednesday.

title: The World Has a Plan to Fight Coronavirus. Most Countries Are Not Using it.
first_paragraph: For weeks, the World Health Organization resisted declaring the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic, fearing that doing so would incite panic across the globe.

title: Coronavirus Tests Europe’s Cohesion, Alliances and Even Democracy
first_paragraph: The rapid spread of the new coronavirus presents a severe test for democracies, for the European Union as an institution and for the trans-Atlantic alliance.

title: A Fumbled Global Response to the Virus in a Leadership Void
first_paragraph: In Frankfurt, the president of the European Central Bank warned that the coronavirus could trigger an economic crash as dire as that of 2008. In Berlin, the German chancellor warned the virus could infect two-thirds of her country’s population. In London, the British prime minister rolled out a nearly $40 billion rescue package to cushion his economy from the shock.

title: Merkel Gives Germans a Hard Truth About the Coronavirus
first_paragraph: Chancellor Angela Merkel is on her way out and her power is waning, but in her typically low-key, no-nonsense manner, the German leader on Wednesday laid out some cold, hard facts on the coronavirus in a way that few other leaders have.

title: U.K. Shields Its Economy From the Virus, but Not Yet Its People
first_paragraph: Britain moved decisively on Wednesday to cushion its economy from the ravages of the coronavirus, as it prepared to toughen a more cautious medical response that had come under fire, particularly after a health minister who had mingled at a reception with Prime Minister Boris Johnson fell ill from the contagion.

title: For Italians, Dodging Coronavirus Has Become a Game of Chance
first_paragraph: As his glasses fogged up from the mask he wore over his mouth and nose, Riccardo Rosso, a historian of mathematics, scribbled on a blackboard the possible outcomes of a dice game, substituting the chances of getting the coronavirus.

title: Xi Goes to Wuhan, Coronavirus Epicenter, in Show of Confidence
first_paragraph: China’s top leader, Xi Jinping, toured Wuhan, the city at the center of a now global epidemic, for the first time since the coronavirus outbreak began, hoping to demonstrate that his government was containing a crisis that has tarnished his image at home and abroad.

title: ‘Proselytizing Robots’: Inside South Korean Church at Outbreak’s Center
first_paragraph: More than 1.2 million citizens have called for the secretive church to be disbanded. One province asked the public to report church members to a hotline for coronavirus testing. Smartphone apps help identify the church’s 1,100 once-obscure facilities in South Korea, most already plastered with “off-limits” signs by disease-control officials.

title: In Egypt, Tourists Torn Between Ancient Temples and Coronavirus Tests
first_paragraph: When tourists in Luxor woke up on Monday to find themselves confined to their hotels or cruise ships on the Nile, it seemed that Egypt was taking extreme measures to confront the coronavirus in the ancient town at the heart of its tourism industry.

title: Italy Announces Restrictions Over Entire Country in Attempt to Halt Coronavirus
first_paragraph: Italy on Monday became the first European country to announce severe nationwide limits on travel as the government struggled to stem the spread of a coronavirus outbreak that has hobbled the economy, threatened to overwhelm public health care and killed more people than anywhere outside China.

title: On Day 1 of Lockdown, Italian Officials Urge Citizens to Abide by Rules
first_paragraph: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte ended his 2:15 a.m. news conference to announce the extraordinary lockdown of Italy’s north with a plea that other heads of state may not have felt compelled to make.

title: Europe, With Eye on Italy Coronavirus Quarantine, Plans Next Moves
first_paragraph: Italy’s sweeping lockdown of its north reverberated through Europe on Sunday, fueling fears of similarly draconian measures from London to Berlin, as officials grappled with how to slow the rapid-fire spread of the coronavirus in several of the world’s most open and democratic societies.

title: Failures on the Diamond Princess Shadow Another Cruise Ship Outbreak
first_paragraph: The email to Princess Cruises was peppered with typos and awkward grammar, but the warning was unmistakable. An 80-year-old passenger had tested positive for the new coronavirus after getting off the Diamond Princess cruise ship in Hong Kong.

title: Italy Locks Down Much of the Country’s North Over the Coronavirus
first_paragraph: Italy’s government early Sunday took the extraordinary step of locking down much of the country’s north, restricting movement for about a quarter of the Italian population in regions that serve as the country’s economic engine.

title: China May Be Beating the Coronavirus, at a Painful Cost
first_paragraph: As the new coronavirus races around the world, tanking markets, cutting off global travel and suspending school for hundreds of millions of children, governments are desperate for ways to contain it.

title: No Handshakes, No New Citizens: Coronavirus Halts Danish Naturalizations
first_paragraph: The mayor of a city in Eastern Denmark was preparing to hold a citizenship ceremony when he received a call from the country’s immigration and integration ministry.

title: On Nile Cruiser, 12 Crew Test Positive for Virus, and Egypt Fears Broader Outbreak
first_paragraph: Twelve crew members aboard a cruise ship on the Nile were placed in isolation on Friday after testing positive for the coronavirus, Egypt’s health ministry said.

title: As Death Toll Mounts, Governments Point Fingers Over Coronavirus
first_paragraph: An Iranian official claimed without evidence that the epidemic could be an American bioweapon, after some U.S. officials said the same about China. Saudi Arabia said its cases were Iran’s fault. South Korea lashed out at Japan over travel restrictions and responded in kind.

title: China Pushes Back as Coronavirus Crisis Damages Its Image
first_paragraph: When the coronavirus epidemic began its relentless march around the world, China’s diplomats reacted harshly toward countries that shut their borders, canceled flights or otherwise restricted travel.

title: Doctors Say U.K. Is Ill Prepared for Coronavirus
first_paragraph: Ventilators in short supply. Intensive care beds already overflowing. Some health workers buying their own face masks or hoods. And if cases of the deadly coronavirus surge in anything like the numbers some experts have predicted, doctors say they would have to consider denying lifesaving care to the frailest patients to prioritize those with better chances of surviving.

title: Shinzo Abe, Japan’s Political Houdini, Can’t Escape Coronavirus Backlash
first_paragraph: For nearly a month, as the coronavirus has threatened the health and economy of Japan, Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has been almost invisible.

title: Italy’s Elderly Suffer Heavy Toll as Coronavirus Spreads
first_paragraph: A table of old men were shooting the breeze next to the bocce ball courts in a Milan recreation center on Wednesday, talking, like seemingly everyone else in northern Italy, about the coronavirus outbreak that had shut down towns, closed all of Italy’s schools and claimed the lives of more than 100 people, almost all of them elderly.

title: ‘When Can We Go to School?’ Nearly 300 Million Children Are Missing Class
first_paragraph: The coronavirus epidemic has reached deeper into daily life across the world, with a sweeping shutdown of all schools in Italy, a suspension of classes in India’s capital and warnings of school closures in the United States, intensifying the educational upheaval of nearly 300 million students globally.

title: Why the Coronavirus Isn’t What This Canadian in Hong Kong Fears Most
first_paragraph: The streets of this city, usually teeming with people, are practically empty, and no one knows when Hong Kong might recover from the coronavirus outbreak that has crippled the economy and devastated tourism. But Lindsay Jang, a Canadian restaurateur, said she is prepared to ride it out.

title: ‘A Slap in the Face’: Chinese Readers Share Their Coronavirus Stories
first_paragraph: The coronavirus outbreak has radiated to at least 77 countries, killing more than 3,200 people and infecting more than 93,000. It has paralyzed cities and towns, disrupted business, travel and schools. But no place has seen more devastation than China, where the overwhelming majority of deaths and infections have occurred.

title: Cruise Ship Held Off California Becomes New Focus of Concern
first_paragraph: Gov. Gavin Newsom announced on Wednesday that a cruise ship returning to California from Hawaii that had suspected links to two coronavirus cases, one of them fatal, was being held off the coast of San Francisco, as public health officials prepared to screen everyone on the ship.

title: Iran’s Coronavirus Response: Pride, Paranoia, Secrecy, Chaos
first_paragraph: Nearly three dozen Iranian government officials and members of parliament are infected and a senior adviser to the supreme leader has died.

title: As Coronavirus Hits U.K., Health Workers Fear Getting Sick, and Going Broke
first_paragraph: Every workday, Al-Hakim arrives at one of London’s largest public hospitals for a shift as a cleaner, earning little more than minimum wage even though his latest job includes disinfecting rooms reserved for suspected coronavirus patients.

title: ‘No Way Out’: In China, Coronavirus Takes Toll on Other Patients
first_paragraph: The 3-year-old boy was anxiously waiting for yet another round of chemotherapy. Then the new coronavirus outbreak hit, and doctors suddenly turned him away.

title: U.S. Will Drop Limits on Virus Testing, Pence Says
first_paragraph: Vice President Mike Pence said the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention was lifting all restrictions on testing for coronavirus, and would be releasing new guidelines to fast-track testing for people who fear they have the virus, even if they are displaying mild symptoms.

title: He Blames ‘Evil’ for South Korea’s Coronavirus Surge. Officials Blame Him.
first_paragraph: To his followers, he is a descendant of the ancient kings who ruled Korea centuries ago, “the angel” Jesus sent for mankind, and the one and only “counselor” who can interpret the symbols and secret codes hidden in the Bible’s Book of Revelation.

title: Outbreak Strikes Seattle Area as Testing Is Scrutinized
first_paragraph: In South Korea, Iran, Italy, France, Germany and now the United States, health officials are trying to stem the growing coronavirus epidemic, tracing those who had come into contact with infected patients, even as they struggled to get a handle on how far the virus had spread.

title: Fear of Coronavirus Leaves the Faithful Without Mass in Italy’s North
first_paragraph: The camera focused on a woman reading a prayer for people infected with the coronavirus, and for the doctors and nurses helping Italy deal with the largest outbreak in Europe.

title: Making a Plague Movie, With Coronavirus on the Doorstep
first_paragraph: Last Saturday, Nicholas Hulbert, a British film director, flew from London to Venice for his latest project.

title: Trump Calls for Calm on Virus and Expands Travel Restrictions
first_paragraph: President Trump sought on Saturday to more aggressively address the coronavirus after weeks of confusion over his administration’s response, urging public calm and issuing new foreign travel warnings and restrictions.

title: Italy’s Quarantine Leaves Locked-Down Towns Feeling ‘Sacrificed’
first_paragraph: The phone call came from inside one of the northern Italian towns quarantined to contain the rapid spread of the coronavirus.

title: Confusion and Contradiction Reign in Iran’s Coronavirus Reporting
first_paragraph: The authorities in Iran, the epicenter of the coronavirus outbreak in the Middle East, reported a 58 percent jump in confirmed infections to 388 on Friday and a 30 percent increase in deaths to 34, and the health minister warned of a “pretty difficult week” ahead.

title: Nigeria Responds to First Coronavirus Case in Sub-Saharan Africa
first_paragraph: An Italian contractor who flew into Nigeria from Milan became sub-Saharan Africa’s first confirmed coronavirus patient on Friday, stoking concern that an outbreak on the continent could overwhelm already strained health care systems.

title: China Spins Coronavirus Crisis, Hailing Itself as a Global Leader
first_paragraph: The Chinese government silenced whistle-blowers, withheld crucial information and played down the threat posed by the new coronavirus, allowing an epidemic that has killed thousands to take hold across the country.

title: Jimmy Lai, Hong Kong Media Baron, Is Arrested Over Role in Protests
first_paragraph: A Hong Kong media tycoon known for his ardent opposition to China was arrested on Friday over his role in a pro-democracy protest last year, the police said, dealing another blow to the city’s independent media.

title: Germany Tries to Solve a Coronavirus Puzzle With ‘Endless Pieces’
first_paragraph: By the time German health officials in the state of North Rhine-Westphalia had confirmed the state’s first case of the coronavirus, the patient was already so ill that he had been placed on a respirator. He was in no position to help authorities, who urgently needed to retrace his steps to try to stop, or at least slow, the virus from spreading.

title: It’s Not the Plague, but Milan Isn’t Itself Either
first_paragraph: “The plague had already entered Milan,” Alessandro Manzoni writes in “The Betrothed,” the 19th century Italian literary classic renowned for its vivid descriptions of the 1630 pestilence that gutted Milan.

title: Iran Vice President Is One of 7 Officials to Contract Coronavirus
first_paragraph: A senior figure in Iran’s government, who sits just a few seats away from President Hassan Rouhani at cabinet meetings, has fallen ill with coronavirus, making her Iran’s seventh official to test positive, including one prominent cleric who has died.

title: Italy, Mired in Politics Over Virus, Asks How Much Testing Is Too Much
first_paragraph: On the sixth floor of a skyscraper, two dozen epidemiologists and public health experts form the nerve center of the effort to contain a coronavirus outbreak in Italy that has alarmed Europe and put the wealthy Lombardy region at the center of global concern.

title: Japan Shocks Parents by Moving to Close All Schools Over Coronavirus
first_paragraph: After weeks of criticism that Japan was bungling its reaction to the spread of the coronavirus, Prime Minister Shinzo Abe took the drastic step on Thursday of asking all the country’s schools to close for about a month.

title: South Korean Leader Said Coronavirus Would ‘Disappear.’ It Was a Costly Error.
first_paragraph: There were 28 cases of the coronavirus in South Korea on Feb. 13. Four days had passed without a new confirmed infection. President Moon Jae-in predicted that the outbreak would “disappear before long,” while the prime minister assured people that it was OK not to wear surgical masks outdoors.

title: Most Coronavirus Cases Are Mild. That’s Good and Bad News.
first_paragraph: As a dangerous new coronavirus has ravaged China and spread throughout the rest of the world, the outbreak’s toll has sown fear and anxiety. Nearly 3,000 deaths. More than 82,000 cases. Six continents infected.

title: Hundreds Confined to Tenerife Hotel for 14 Days Over Coronavirus Fears
first_paragraph: Hundreds of guests at a resort on Tenerife, the largest of the Canary Islands, were told Wednesday that they would be confined to their hotel for 14 days as the authorities tried to prevent the coronavirus from spreading after infections were discovered there this week.

title: In U.S. and Germany, Community Transmission Is Now Suspected
first_paragraph: President Trump named Vice President Mike Pence his point person to coordinate the government’s response to the coronavirus, expressing confidence that the United States would prevent a widespread domestic outbreak.

title: Spread of Virus Could Hasten the Great Coming Apart of Globalization
first_paragraph: Globalization, that awkward catchall for our interconnectedness, was already under assault from populists, terrorists, trade warriors and climate activists, having become an easy target for much that ails us.

title: Spanish Hotel Is Locked Down After Guests Test Positive for Coronavirus
first_paragraph: The Spanish authorities scrambled on Tuesday to trace everyone who had contact with an Italian doctor and his partner who tested positive for the coronavirus while on vacation in the Canary Islands, locking down a major resort with hundreds of guests in the hopes of limiting any possible outbreak.

title: Coronavirus Spreads to Soccer’s Schedule, Closing Stadiums and Stranding Teams
first_paragraph: In China, officials struggling to contain the spread of the coronavirus have delayed the start of the soccer season for months, and at least one top-division team has been marooned in the Middle East for weeks, unable to return from a preseason training camp.

title: In Coronavirus Crisis, Korean City Tries Openness, a Contrast to China
first_paragraph: The usually crowded shopping and partying district in this city of 2.4 million is quieter these days after officials urged citizens to stay home to contain an explosive outbreak of the coronavirus. But many restaurants and bars remain open, waiting for customers who seldom come.

title: U.S. Soldier Tests Positive for Virus in South Korea
first_paragraph: An American soldier in South Korea has tested positive for the new coronavirus, the U.S. military said on Wednesday.

title: ‘Recipe for a Massive Viral Outbreak’: Iran Emerges as a Worldwide Threat
first_paragraph: Religious pilgrims, migrant workers, businessmen, soldiers and clerics all flow constantly across Iran’s frontiers, often crossing into countries with few border controls, weak and ineffective governments and fragile health systems.

title: Spreading Across Continents, a Lethal Virus Tests a Fraying Global Order
first_paragraph: In Iran, a spike in coronavirus infections has prompted fears of a contagion throughout the Middle East. In Italy, one of Europe’s largest economies, officials are struggling frantically to prevent the epidemic from paralyzing the commercial center of Milan. And in New York, London, and Tokyo, financial markets plummeted on fears that the virus will cripple the global economy.

title: Coronavirus Stalls Milan, Italy’s Economic Engine
first_paragraph: The landmark Duomo Cathedral, its spires towering over Milan, is closed. So are La Scala, Italy’s premier opera house, and the city’s universities and schools. Bars are shuttered at the sacred aperitivo hour. The usually buzzing streets, trams, restaurants and shops are all eerily empty.

title: As Fears of a Pandemic Mount, W.H.O. Says World Is Not Ready
first_paragraph: As new cases of the coronavirus spiked on two continents, the World Health Organization warned on Monday that the world was not ready for a major outbreak, even as it praised China’s aggressive efforts to wrest the epidemic under control.

title: Hong Kong Says It Will Begin Evacuating Residents From Wuhan
first_paragraph: The Hong Kong government, which has faced growing demands to evacuate its residents from mainland China after one died of the coronavirus, said on Monday that it would begin bringing people back from Hubei Province, the center of the outbreak.

title: Businesses ‘Getting Killed’ on Russian Border as Coronavirus Fears Rise
first_paragraph: With a contagious illness raging in China, just 600 yards away across the frozen Amur River, the Cathedral of the Annunciation in the Russian border city of Blagoveshchensk thundered with promises of salvation from the plague.

title: For China’s Overwhelmed Doctors, an Understanding Voice Across the Ocean
first_paragraph: A nurse called the 24-hour hotline to complain about a constant headache. A doctor said he was feeling ostracized by the public, even as he worked to save patients from the epidemic. One caller said she was feeling suicidal.

title: Europe Confronts Coronavirus as Italy Battles an Eruption of Cases
first_paragraph: Europe confronted its first major outbreak of the coronavirus as an eruption of more than 150 cases in Italy prompted officials on Sunday to lock down at least 10 towns, close schools in major cities and cancel sporting events and cultural touchstones, including the end of the Venice carnival.

title: As Coronavirus Cases Spiral, South Korea Raises Threat Alert Level
first_paragraph: As South Korea struggles to contain a snowballing coronavirus outbreak, its president on Sunday raised the country’s alert level to the highest for the first time in a decade, which empowered the government to lock down cities, bar visitors from China and unilaterally restrict the movement of people.

title: Religious Groups in China Step Into the Coronavirus Crisis
first_paragraph: Earlier this month, the hard-hit town of Caohe, near the center of the coronavirus outbreak in central China, received an unexpected gift: a large donation from a Taoist nunnery 550 miles away. Another Taoist temple, this one in Caohe itself, contributed tens of thousands of dollars worth of medical equipment to help those sickened by the virus.

title: ‘We’re in a Petri Dish’: How a Coronavirus Ravaged a Cruise Ship
first_paragraph: The captain came over the intercom early in the evening: A passenger who had left the ship nine days earlier had tested positive for the new coronavirus sweeping through China.

title: What a Party in Japan May Tell Us About the Coronavirus’s Spread
first_paragraph: Rain was falling on the night of Jan. 18, so the windows of the Tokyo party boat were shut. Inside were about 90 guests of a local taxi association who were celebrating the new year as the vessel floated down the Sumida River. Also on board, unbeknown to them, was a coronavirus capable of spreading ferociously.

title: Hundreds Released From Diamond Princess Cruise Ship in Japan
first_paragraph: Hundreds of passengers walked off a coronavirus-stricken cruise ship Wednesday after getting the all-clear from the Japanese authorities, but the scene that greeted them as their feet touched solid ground for the first time in weeks suggested that some found the assurances less than reassuring.

title: She Left Wuhan to Become a Journalist. She’s Back in Time to Get the Story.
first_paragraph: It didn’t take long for an army of volunteers to emerge in Wuhan after the authorities put the city on lockdown to stop the spread of the coronavirus. Anna Liu just didn’t expect to be one of them.

title: Japan Reports 2 Deaths Among Cruise Ship Passengers
first_paragraph: Two passengers from the cruise ship quarantined in Japan have died after contracting the new coronavirus, the first deaths among the more than 600 people on board who have been infected, a Japanese health ministry official said on Thursday.

title: Coronavirus Epidemic Keeps Growing, but Spread in China Slows
first_paragraph: Chinese officials hailed recent figures as evidence that the spread of the coronavirus epidemic has slowed, and World Health Organization officials said on Tuesday that China’s strict limits on its people’s movements have helped.

title: In Europe, Fear Spreads Faster Than the Coronavirus Itself
first_paragraph: A British man who tested positive for coronavirus was branded a “super spreader,” his every movement detailed by the local media.

title: New Cases in China Appear to Be Slowing
first_paragraph: Passengers began disembarking on Wednesday from a cruise ship docked off Yokohama, Japan, as a two-week quarantine of the vessel was coming to an end even as a major coronavirus outbreak on board continued unabated.

title: Cambodia’s Coronavirus Complacency May Exact a Global Toll
first_paragraph: When Cambodia’s prime minister greeted passengers on a cruise ship amid a coronavirus scare on Valentine’s Day, embraces were the order of the day. Protective masks were not.

title: Battling Coronavirus, China Signals Delay of Its Top Party Gathering
first_paragraph: China signaled on Monday that it would postpone its most important political spectacle of the year, a sign of deepening anxiety within the ruling Communist Party about the threat posed by the coronavirus epidemic.

title: Coronavirus Empties European Cities of Chinese Tourists
first_paragraph: The line in front of the Louis Vuitton store was barely a line by Paris standards: only 10 people. All were Asian and many spoke in Chinese, with one couple dictating Mandarin into a smartphone and waiting for the answers in French.

title: They Escaped an Infected Ship, but the Flight Home Was No Haven
first_paragraph: The ground rules were clear. A day before 328 Americans were to be whisked away from a contaminated cruise ship in Japan, the U.S. Embassy in Tokyo told passengers that no one infected with the coronavirus would be allowed to board charter flights to the United States.

title: ‘Now We Are Refugees’: A Family in Limbo Amid the Coronavirus Outbreak
first_paragraph: These days, Chloe Chang, a Taiwanese woman stranded at the center of China’s coronavirus outbreak, says she wakes up every half-hour during the night. Sometimes she breaks down in tears.

title: U.S. Passengers Evacuate Quarantined Cruise Ship in Japan
first_paragraph: American passengers evacuated a cruise ship that had been quarantined for more than a week in the Japanese port city of Yokohama, after hundreds of people on board fell ill with the coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus Infection Found After Cruise Ship Passengers Disperse
first_paragraph: The cruise ship had been shunned at port after port for fear it might carry the coronavirus, but when the Westerdam arrived in Cambodia on Thursday, the prime minister greeted its passengers with flowers.

title: China’s Leader, Under Fire, Says He Led Coronavirus Fight Early On
first_paragraph: Under fire for its response to the coronavirus epidemic, China’s authoritarian government appears to be pushing a new account of events that presents President Xi Jinping as taking early action to fight the outbreak that has convulsed the country.

title: France Confirms First Death in Europe From Coronavirus
first_paragraph: A Chinese tourist has died in France of the coronavirus, the French health minister said on Saturday, becoming the outbreak’s first fatality in Europe and outside Asia.

title: Shifting Ground in Coronavirus Fight: U.S. Will Evacuate Americans From Cruise Ship
first_paragraph: For much of this past week, as a dangerous viral outbreak continued to rattle the world, officials seemed keen to offer reassurances. Chinese leaders urged people to get back to work. American officials said they saw no need to evacuate citizens from a quarantined cruise ship in Japan.

title: Beijing Tightens Quarantine Rules in Coronavirus Battle
first_paragraph: The authorities in China tightened their coronavirus quarantine rules for Beijing on Friday, saying that all residents returning from outside the capital city would be required to isolate themselves for 14 days.

title: China’s Doctors, Fighting the Coronavirus, Beg for Masks
first_paragraph: In the hospital where Yu Yajie works, nurses, doctors and other medical professionals fighting the new coronavirus have also been fighting dire shortages. They have used tape to patch up battered protective masks, repeatedly reused goggles meant for one-time use, and wrapped their shoes in plastic bags for lack of specialized coverings.

title: U.S. Supports Aid to North Korea for Fighting the Coronavirus
first_paragraph: The United States said it would approve humanitarian assistance to North Korea to help international aid agencies fight the coronavirus there, amid fears that the impoverished country may be hiding an outbreak.

title: China Expands Chaotic Dragnet in Coronavirus Crackdown
first_paragraph: China’s leaders expanded a mass roundup of people possibly sickened with the coronavirus on Thursday, widening their dragnet well beyond the epicenter of the outbreak to at least two more cities in what the government has called a “wartime” campaign to stamp out the epidemic.

title: Coronavirus ‘Hits All the Hot Buttons’ for How We Misjudge Risk
first_paragraph: Shortly after the University of Washington announced that the school’s fourth suspected case of the new coronavirus had turned out negative, two professors, one of public policy and the other of public health, held a small dinner for students and faculty members.

title: A Timeline of the Coronavirus Pandemic
first_paragraph: The coronavirus, which surfaced in a Chinese seafood and poultry market in December 2019, has spread to nearly every country, upending life and derailing the global economy. The virus has killed more than 1.6 million and sickened more than 76 million over the last year. The World Health Organization has declared the situation a global pandemic.

title: How the Coronavirus Numbers Changed So Sharply
first_paragraph: The number of cases and deaths in the coronavirus epidemic in China jumped sharply on Thursday as the authorities there changed how they keep track of the disease, and not, primarily, because of any change in the shape of the outbreak.

title: As Passenger Angst Grows, Japan to Let Some Off Ship, but Fewer Than Hoped
first_paragraph: For a moment on Thursday, John and Carol Montgomery thought they might be departing early from the cruise ship quarantined in Yokohama, Japan, where new cases of the coronavirus have been confirmed almost daily.

title: China Ousts 2 Party Officials Amid Outrage About Coronavirus Response
first_paragraph: China’s leader, Xi Jinping, summarily ousted two top Communist Party officials from the province at the center of the coronavirus epidemic on Thursday, exacting political punishment for the regional government’s handling of a crisis that seemed far from under control.

title: An American in a Locked Down Chinese Town: ‘Everyone Here Is So Bored’
first_paragraph: Weeks before the coronavirus became a national health crisis in China, authorities threatened a doctor, Li Wenliang, who warned about early cases. State media reported that Dr. Li was illegally spreading rumors.

title: China Is Tracking Travelers From Hubei
first_paragraph: To combat the spread of the coronavirus, Chinese officials are using a combination of technology and policing to track movements of citizens who may have visited Hubei Province.

title: How Many Coronavirus Cases in China? Officials Tweak the Answer
first_paragraph: The news was abrupt and, to some, surprising: Overnight, a Chinese province near Russia, had cut its count of confirmed coronavirus cases by more than a dozen.

title: For a Chinese Traveler, Even Paradise Comes With Prejudice
first_paragraph: Jeju Island, with white sand beaches and a volcanic landscape, is a slice of paradise off the coast of South Korea, but Iris Yao has not found it particularly relaxing.

title: Coronavirus Forces Foreign Students in China to Choose: Stay or Go
first_paragraph: Word came from home via hurried emails and instant messages to campuses across the country: Leave China now.

title: Quarantined Cruise Passengers Have Many Questions. Japan Has Few Answers.
first_paragraph: The 3,600 people aboard the Diamond Princess, locked down for more than a week and desperate for information, have been reduced to peering out windows as hazmat-suited workers take away the newest coronavirus patients and mysterious buses, their interiors shrouded by curtains, come and go from the port.

title: Chinese Students Abroad: How Are You Affected by the Coronavirus Outbreak?
first_paragraph: The coronavirus outbreak has radiated from its epicenter in Wuhan to nearly 30 countries and regions, killing more than 800 people and infecting more than 30,000. It has paralyzed cities and villages throughout China and upended business, travel and schools around the globe. Fears about the outbreak have also fueled xenophobia and in some cases, outright anti-Chinese sentiment.

title: U.K. Businessman Linked to Coronavirus Cluster Comes Forward
first_paragraph: A British businessman believed to be the source of a cluster of coronavirus cases in Britain and France came forward on Tuesday, saying that he had fully recovered but would remain in isolation as a precaution.

title: Indonesia Has No Reported Coronavirus Cases. Is That the Whole Picture?
first_paragraph: The family from Shanghai was vacationing in Singapore last month when they learned that the new coronavirus had arrived there from China.

title: ‘Let’s Not Shake Hands’: Xi Jinping Tours Beijing Amid Coronavirus Crisis
first_paragraph: When he stepped inside the municipal office five miles north of the Forbidden City, China’s most powerful leader in decades pulled up the sleeve of his black overcoat and held out his wrist. A woman in a mask and surgical gloves then checked to see if he had a fever.

title: U.K. Declares Coronavirus ‘Imminent Threat’ as Europe Scrambles
first_paragraph: Britain’s health department declared the new coronavirus an “imminent threat” to public health and announced a series of measures to combat the spread of the virus, a sign of the seriousness with which local health authorities are treating the fears of the epidemic.

title: Coronavirus Epidemic Reaches Bleak Milestone, Exceeding SARS Toll
first_paragraph: The coronavirus epidemic in China surpassed a grim milestone on Sunday with a death toll that exceeds that of the SARS outbreak 17 years ago, a development that coincided with news that World Health Organization experts might soon be in the country to help stanch the crisis.

title: Her Grandmother Got the Coronavirus. Then So Did the Whole Family.
first_paragraph: Bella Zhang hung an intravenous drip on a spindly tree branch and slumped down on a large stone planter outside the crowded hospital. Her mother and brother sat wearily beside her, their shoulders sagging, both also hooked up to their own drips.

title: As Virus Cases Rise on Quarantined Cruise Ship, Passengers Are on Edge
first_paragraph: As the Diamond Princess cruise ship steamed back into port in Yokohama, Japan, on Sunday morning after a night of quarantine at sea, passengers lucky enough to have windows and balconies could see fire trucks and 15 ambulances waiting for the ship.

title: Deaths in China Surpass Toll From SARS
first_paragraph: The coronavirus death toll in China has risen to 908, surpassing the toll from the SARS epidemic of 2002-3, according to official data.

title: Where’s Xi? China’s Leader Commands Coronavirus Fight From Safe Heights
first_paragraph: President Xi Jinping strode onstage before an adoring audience in the Great Hall of the People in Beijing less than three weeks ago, trumpeting his successes in steering China through a tumultuous year and promising “landmark” progress in 2020.

title: First American Dies of Coronavirus, Raising Questions About U.S. Response
first_paragraph: A United States citizen died from the coronavirus in Wuhan, China, American officials said on Saturday. It was the first known American death from the illness, and was likely to add to diplomatic friction over Beijing’s response to the epidemic.

title: A New Martyr Puts a Face on China’s Deepening Coronavirus Crisis
first_paragraph: More than 700 people have died. Tens of thousands are infected. Millions are living under lockdown, and the government has sought to silence complaints.

title: Jump in Coronavirus Cases on Ship Poses a Critical Test for Japan
first_paragraph: Japan already had several confirmed coronavirus cases when a giant cruise ship arrived at the port of Yokohama last week.

title: Minimizing Risk in a Global Panic
first_paragraph: As someone who has been living between Hong Kong and Sydney for the past few months, I have been engaged in a relentless, entirely circular conversation with family, friends and colleagues about the coronavirus that sprang into the global consciousness a couple of weeks ago and since then has claimed at least 563 lives, while sickening more than 28,000 others.

title: Africa, Intertwined With China, Fears Coronavirus Outbreak
first_paragraph: As the 9 a.m. flight from Dubai arrived at the international airport in Ethiopia’s capital on Wednesday, four government health specialists in face masks and protective glasses worked their way to the line of incoming passengers to check their passports.

title: China Tightens Wuhan Lockdown in ‘Wartime’ Battle With Coronavirus
first_paragraph: The Chinese authorities resorted to increasingly extreme measures in Wuhan on Thursday to try to halt the spread of the deadly coronavirus, ordering house-to-house searches, rounding up the sick and warehousing them in enormous quarantine centers.

title: What It’s Like to Be Quarantined on an Island Over Coronavirus Fears
first_paragraph: Life in an immigration detention center on Australia’s Christmas Island has not been as bad as David Huang feared. It is certainly a far cry from the conditions that thousands of asylum seekers have faced in the country’s offshore detention centers in recent years.

title: ‘I Keep Hearing Painful Coughs’: Life on Quarantined Cruise Ship
first_paragraph: Things were looking up on Thursday for the more than 2,000 passengers quarantined on a cruise ship in Yokohama, Japan: Meals were coming on a more regular schedule. The internet was upgraded to a wider bandwidth. And there was even official approval to breathe some fresh air.

title: Losing Track of Time in the Epicenter of China’s Coronavirus Outbreak
first_paragraph: In the mornings, Wuhan is so quiet that bird calls sound down once busy streets. Stray dogs trot in the middle of empty expressways. Residents wrapped in masks creep out of their homes, anxiety flitting across their eyes.

title: Trapped on a Cruise Ship by the Coronavirus: When Is Breakfast?
first_paragraph: Hidden away in her cabin, Masako Ishida reckons she doesn’t face much risk from the coronavirus that has stalked her cruise ship, forcing an onboard quarantine of 3,700 passengers and crew members in the port city of Yokohama.

title: In Coronavirus, China Weighs Benefits of Buffalo Horn and Other Remedies
first_paragraph: As it races to treat patients infected with the new coronavirus, the Chinese government is seeing potential in a cocktail of antiviral drugs. It is also recommending the Peaceful Palace Bovine Pill, a traditional Chinese medicine made with the gallstone of cattle, buffalo horn, jasmine and pearl.

title: Giving the Gift of Mobility in a City Locked Down by Coronavirus
first_paragraph: His days are long, 12 hours crisscrossing the city and ferrying local residents to buy groceries, get medicine and go to the hospital. And the roads he travels are mostly empty since the city was sealed off, public transportation was shut down, and private vehicles were mostly banned in an effort to contain the coronavirus.

title: Hong Kong Reports Its First Coronavirus Death as Outbreak Widens
first_paragraph: A patient diagnosed with the new coronavirus became Hong Kong’s first fatality from the affliction Tuesday as Thailand reported six more cases, Japan quarantined a cruise ship because of a passenger’s infection and Macau shut its casinos, underscoring the contagion’s spread beyond mainland China.

title: Beijing Sees ‘Major Test’ as Doors to China Close and Coronavirus Deaths Surpass SARS
first_paragraph: China’s Communist Party leadership called the month-old coronavirus epidemic a “major test” on Monday as other nations escalated efforts to isolate China, unnerving China’s stock market, depressing global oil prices and raising new anxiety about the world’s most populous country.

title: Beijing in the Time of Coronavirus: No Traffic, Empty Parks and Fear
first_paragraph: The Apple stores were among the busiest places still open in Beijing after the coronavirus outbreak, though employees forbade customers to try the watches or AirPods.

title: China Pledged to Build a New Hospital in 10 Days. It’s Close.
first_paragraph: People desperate for treatment started descending on a new hospital that was mostly built in just 10 days to help cope with the outbreak of the new coronavirus in the central city of Wuhan on Monday.

title: Hong Kong Tightens Border as Medical Workers Call for Shutdown
first_paragraph: Hong Kong’s government said Monday that it would close more border checkpoints, as some medical workers went on strike to demand a complete ban on entries from mainland China to limit the outbreak of the new coronavirus.

title: Philippines Reports First Coronavirus Death Outside China
first_paragraph: A 44-year-old man in the Philippines has died of the coronavirus, the first known fatality outside China, health officials said on Sunday, as the number of deaths jumped to more than 360 and other countries expanded travel restrictions in an effort to slow the spread of the outbreak.

title: Coronavirus Pummels Wuhan, a City Short of Supplies and Overwhelmed
first_paragraph: Weak with fever, An Jianhua waited in line for seven hours outside the hospital in the cold, hoping to get tested for the new coronavirus, which doctors suspected she had contracted.

title: Quieter Response to Coronavirus in Countries Where China Holds Sway
first_paragraph: In Myanmar, loudspeakers broadcast advice from Buddhist monks: Seven ground peppercorns, exactly seven, placed on the tongue will ward off the coronavirus spreading across Asia and the world.

title: China Increasingly Walled Off as Countries Seek to Stem Coronavirus
first_paragraph: New walls are rising between China and the world as the country grapples with a fast-moving coronavirus and its mounting death toll.

title: As New Coronavirus Spread, China’s Old Habits Delayed Fight
first_paragraph: A mysterious illness had stricken seven patients at a hospital, and a doctor tried to warn his medical school classmates. “Quarantined in the emergency department,” the doctor, Li Wenliang, wrote in an online chat group on Dec. 30, referring to patients.

title: SARS Was Deadly in Canada. Is the Country Ready for Coronavirus?
first_paragraph: Canada Letter is a weekly newsletter from our Canada bureau, written by Canadian correspondent Ian Austen. Sign up to get it by email.

title: An Outbreak of Racist Sentiment as Coronavirus Reaches Australia
first_paragraph: Recently, when Andy Miao takes the train to work in Sydney, he has noticed other people’s disapproving looks if he does not wear a face mask. Although he does not have the coronavirus, Mr. Miao, who is of Chinese heritage and grew up in Australia, knows it’s because of one reason: his ethnicity.

title: State Department Warns Against Traveling to China Amid Coronavirus Outbreak
first_paragraph: The State Department on Thursday night issued an advisory telling Americans not to travel to China because of the public health threat posed by the coronavirus, as world health officials grappled with the expanding footprint of the outbreak.

title: Coronavirus Anger Boils Over in China and Doctors Plead for Supplies
first_paragraph: One week into a lockdown, anger and anxiety deepened in China on Thursday as the central province at the center of the coronavirus outbreak endured shortages of hospital beds, medical supplies and doctors.

title: As Coronavirus Spreads, So Does Anti-Chinese Sentiment
first_paragraph: In Japan, the hashtag #ChineseDon’tComeToJapan has been trending on Twitter. In Singapore, tens of thousands of residents have signed a petition calling for the government to ban Chinese nationals from entering the country.

title: Cruise Passengers Are Held at Italian Port in False Alarm Over Coronavirus
first_paragraph: Thousands of passengers stuck on a towering cruise ship. Doctors racing to the scene. Confusion and fear spreading.

title: Foreigners Airlifted From Chinese City at Heart of Coronavirus Outbreak
first_paragraph: About 200 Americans evacuated from Wuhan, China, landed at a military base in Southern California on Wednesday, as countries around the world began pulling their citizens from the epicenter of the coronavirus outbreak.

title: More Than 7,700 Cases of Coronavirus Recorded Worldwide
first_paragraph: Mainland China now has more cases of coronavirus than it had of SARS, a respiratory infection that spread across China in 2002 and 2003 and killed 774 people in 17 countries. During the SARS outbreak, China had 5,327 cases and 349 deaths, according to the World Health Organization.

title: Containing the Coronavirus: Countries Limit Travel to China
first_paragraph: Countries, cities and businesses across the globe issued new travel warnings on Tuesday, vastly expanding a cordon intended to control the flow of people to and from China, where the authorities are struggling to contain the outbreak of the new coronavirus.

title: A Divided Hong Kong Confronts the Arrival of the Coronavirus
first_paragraph: The two Hong Kong protesters were dressed head to toe in black, their faces covered in masks. They smashed their Molotov cocktails into the lobby of a public housing estate, and flames and smoke began spewing out.

title: Chinese Officials Race to Contain Anger Over Virus
first_paragraph: The Chinese government scrambled to contain not only the coronavirus epidemic but also growing expressions of public fury over the management of the crisis as the death toll rose on Tuesday to at least 106.

title: Alarm Grows as Markets Tumble and Death Toll Rises
first_paragraph: This briefing has ended. Read the latest developments in our live coronavirus outbreak coverage here.

title: As Coronavirus Fears Intensify, Effectiveness of Quarantines Is Questioned
first_paragraph: A top Chinese health official warned on Sunday that the spread of the dangerous new coronavirus, already extraordinarily rapid, is accelerating further, deepening global fears about an illness that has sickened more than 2,700 people worldwide and killed at least 80 people in China.

title: In Coronavirus, a ‘Battle’ That Could Humble China’s Strongman
first_paragraph: It took thousands of infections and scores of deaths from a mysterious virus for China’s authoritarian leader to publicly say what had become glaringly obvious to many in recent weeks: The country is facing a grave public health crisis.

title: California Confirms Coronavirus Patient, Marking Third U.S. Case
first_paragraph: The United States has confirmed a third case of the novel coronavirus, after a traveler from China tested positive for the disease in Orange County, Calif.

title: Effects of Coronavirus Begin Echoing Far From Wuhan Epicenter
first_paragraph: The repercussions from a mysterious virus that has sickened hundreds of people began reverberating far from its epicenter in central China on Saturday, as Hong Kong closed its schools for several weeks, Beijing began restricting buses in and out of the capital, and the country’s travel association suspended Chinese tour groups heading overseas.

title: Coronavirus Exposes Core Flaws, and Few Strengths, in China’s Governance
first_paragraph: It was the initial news reports that first suggested China’s political system might be getting in the way of its ability to confront the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Fear of Virus Ruins the ‘Happiest Day’ for Millions of Chinese
first_paragraph: The Lunar New Year festivities were just hours away, but instead of helping to prepare a joyous family banquet, Chen Yanming stood anxiously outside a hospital where her father was being tested for a dangerous new virus.

title: Coronavirus Outbreak Sours Japan on Chinese Tourist Boom
first_paragraph: Just as Japan and China have been taking tentative steps toward moving past old animosities, a fast-spreading virus threatens to push them apart.

title: Panic and Criticism Spread on Chinese Social Media Over Coronavirus
first_paragraph: While China’s state-run media has urged calm and praised the official response to the coronavirus outbreak, a different story is playing out across the country’s tightly controlled social media networks.

title: China Expands Virus Lockdown, Encircling 35 Million
first_paragraph: The authorities drastically expanded a travel lockdown in central China on Thursday, essentially penning in more than 35 million residents to contain a deadly virus that is overwhelming hospitals and fueling fears of a pandemic.

title: How China’s Virus Outbreak Could Threaten the Global Economy
first_paragraph: The outbreak of a deadly disease in China has cast a pall over growth prospects for the world’s second largest economy, raising fears about the global outlook if the mysterious coronavirus spreads or worsens.

title: China’s Battle With a Deadly Coronavirus, in Photos
first_paragraph: The spread of a mysterious respiratory virus has prompted the authorities to limit travel in cities in China, including Wuhan, where the disease was first found last month. It has since spread across the nation and to at least 10 other countries.

title: Coronavirus Deaths Are So Far Mostly Older Men, Many With Previous Health Issues
first_paragraph: When the man finally went to a hospital, he had been sick for a week. It was Dec. 26, and Mr. Zeng, 61, was weak with a cough. He got worse. A day later he was transferred to intensive care, and on Dec. 30 he was put on a ventilator to try to keep him alive.

title: China Confirms New Coronavirus Spreads From Humans to Humans
first_paragraph: The mysterious coronavirus that has killed at least four people and sickened more than 200 in China is capable of spreading from person to person, a prominent Chinese scientist said on Monday, adding to fears of a broader epidemic.

title: Deadly Mystery Virus Reported in 2 New Chinese Cities and South Korea
first_paragraph: The authorities in China reported a third death from a mysterious virus and more than 130 new cases over the weekend, including ones found in Beijing and southern China for the first time. One new case was also reported in South Korea on Monday.

title: Japan and Thailand Confirm New Cases of Chinese Coronavirus
first_paragraph: Thailand and Japan each reported new cases of a coronavirus that has left two people dead and at least 40 sick in China, adding to concerns about the spread of the virus beyond Chinese borders ahead of a major holiday.

title: China Reports First Death From New Virus
first_paragraph: Chinese state media on Saturday reported the first known death from a new virus that has infected dozens of people in China and set off worries across Asia.
